And there are millions of unemployed people desperate to do any job. All they need is a chance. It's like wedding photographers. I have a friend who was asked $3000 for 4 hours taking pictures. I'm willing to believe taking pictures involve some technique and some experience, but I can't believe it's so hard to learn that it is worth $750/ hours. Then you can look at how much a nanny costs. i.e. very expensive. Why? Is there a shortage of women who can look after a baby? How long do you need to train them? And don't even start me on realtards who earn 3% of a huge transaction, often with very little work. This 3% would be competed away if not protected by the NAR cartel. This whole economy is made of pockets of people who make way too much money. It will fix itself provided the Feds don't flood the world with such easy money that no one really tries.
